intro: Parietaria serbica, commonly known as the Serbian wallbine, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its hairy leaves and small greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas such as woodland edges and stream banks. It produces small, round fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Parietaria serbica is often considered a weed but can provide habitat for various insects and small animals.
